Classes¶

These classes do most of the work in bhp_crypto, especially Cryptor and FieldCryptor.

class bhp_crypto.classes.BaseCryptor¶

Bases: bhp_string.classes.base_string.BaseString

is_encrypted(value, prefix=None)¶

The value string is considered encrypted if it starts with ‘self.HASH_PREFIX’ or whichever prefix is passed.

mask(value, mask='<encrypted>')¶

Help format values for display by masking them if encrypted at the time of display.

class bhp_crypto.classes.Cryptor(algorithm, mode=None, **kwargs)¶

Bases: bhp_crypto.classes.base_cryptor.BaseCryptor

Base class for all classes providing RSA and AES encryption methods.

aes_decrypt(secret, is_encoded=True, **kwargs)¶

AES decrypts a value using the random iv stored with the secret where secret is a tuple (secret_text, sep, iv).

Will return plaintext or the original secret tuple

aes_encrypt(plaintext, **kwargs)¶

Returns secret as a tuple (secret,iv) or fail.

get_encrypted_salt(algorithm, mode)¶

Sets and returns the encrypted_salt for the given algorithm and mode.

Gets from PRELOADED_KEYS or reads from the file but will always reset it.

is_preloaded_with_keys(msg=None)¶

Checks if keys are preloaded and returns False on the first missing key.

If msg is passed, will run through all keys displaying a message for each missing key.

preload_all_keys()¶

Forces all keys to be loaded into preload dictionary .

rsa_decrypt(secret, is_encoded=True, **kwargs)¶

Returns plaintext or secret if the private key is not available.

Secret is base64 encoded unless ‘is_encoded’ is false.

rsa_encrypt(plaintext, **kwargs)¶

Return an un-encoded secret or fail.

set_aes_key(**kwargs)¶

Decrypted and set the AES key using the rsa private key for the given mode.

Keyword Arguments:
  • algorithm – must be ‘aes’ (default: no default).
  • mode – the mode dictionary key. For example local (default: no default).

Note

have not implemented default values for keyword args as a precaution for an incorrectly configured instance.

set_private_key(keyfile=None, **kwargs)¶

Load the rsa private key and return True, if available, otherwise return False.

‘irreversible’ does not have a private key so:
>>> keyfile = self.VALID_MODES.get(algorithm).get(mode).get('private', None)
>>> keyfile
>>> None
Keyword Arguments:
  • algorithm – rsa, aes (default: no default).
  • mode – the mode dictionary key. For example local (default: no default).
set_public_key(keyfile=None, **kwargs)¶

Load the rsa public key.

Keyword Arguments
  • algorithm: rsa, aes (default: no default).
  • mode: the mode dictionary key. For example local (default: no default).
class bhp_crypto.classes.FieldCryptor(algorithm, mode)¶

Bases: object

Subclass to be used with models that expect to stored just the hash and for this class to handle the secret.

decrypt(secret, secret_is_hash=True, **kwargs)¶

Decrypt secret and if secret is a hash, use hash to lookup the real secret first.

Do not assume secret is an encrypted value, look for HASH_PREFIX or secret prefix. By default we expect secret to be the stored field value – which is a hash. If we use this method for a secret that is not a hash, then the prefix is the SECRET_PREFIX and the lookup step is skipped.

encrypt(value, **kwargs)¶

Return the encrypted field value (hash+secret) where secret is secret or secret+secret_iv.

get_hash(value)¶

Returns the hashed value without hash_prefix by either splitting it from value or hashing value.

get_prep_value(encrypted_value, value, **kwargs)¶

Gets the hash from encrypted value for the DB

update_secret_in_lookup(hash_secret)¶

Given a hash+secret string, updates lookup with hashed_value and secret pairs

class bhp_crypto.classes.Hasher(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: object

handle all hashing

get_hash(value, algorithm, mode, salt)¶

Returns a salted value as an iterated SHA256 hash

Management Classes¶

These classes are used mostly by the management commands.

class bhp_crypto.classes.ModelCryptor¶

Bases: object

decrypt_instance(instance, encrypted_field_object=<class 'bhp_crypto.classes.base_encrypted_field.BaseEncryptedField'>)¶

Returns a modified instance (not saved), encrypt all un-encrypted field objects in a given model instance.

decrypt_model(model)¶

decrypt and save all encrypted field objects in a given model

encrypt_instance(instance, save=True)¶

Encrypts the instance by calling save_base (not save!).

encrypt_model(model, save=True, **kwargs)¶

Encrypts instances for a given model.

Selects a queryset of unencrypted instances to operate on.

Keyword Arguments: print_on_save – print a message to stdout on each save (default: True) save_message – message to print after each instance is saved which may include {0} and {1} for ‘instance_count’, ‘instance_total’ (default: 37/35666 instances encrypted ...). field_name – filter unencrypted instances on the field object with this attname only.

get_all_encrypted_models()¶

Returns a dictionary of models per app in the format {app_name: [encrypted_models, ...]}.

get_encrypted_fields(model, **kwargs)¶

Returns a list of field objects that use encryption.

Keyword Arguments: field_name – return a list with field object of this attname only. Name is ignored if not a field using encrytion.

get_encrypted_models(app_name, **kwargs)¶

Returns a dictionary of model objects that contain encrypted fields in the format { model_name: {model, fields}}.

is_instance_encrypted(**kwargs)¶

Check if field values in instance are encrypted.

Note: this is much slower than just saving the instance!!

Keyword Arguments: instance – a model instance (default: None) field_name – filter on the field object with this attname only suppress_messages – whether to print messages to stdout (default: False)

is_model_encrypted(**kwargs)¶

Check if instances in model are encrypted. Note: this is much slower than just saving the instances!!

Keyword Arguments: model – checks all instances within model (default: None) field_name – filter on the field object with this attname only suppress_messages – whether to print messages to stdout (default: False)

class bhp_crypto.classes.KeyGenerator¶

Bases: object

get_key_paths()¶

Returns a list of key pathnames

test_keys()¶

Tests keys
